urls.title: HMRC responds to Treasury Committee on recent customer service outage - Committees - UK Parliament
urls.description: The Treasury Committee today publishes the response to a series of questions on last week’s HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) customer service outage.

data.text:
🖋️ Last week, Chair @hbaldwin wrote to @HMRCgovuk regarding its customer service outage, during which phone lines and online services were shut. 

✉️ We've just published HMRC's response.

🔎 Learn more and read the letter in full here 👇
https://t.co/dhe8hwgt1E

🗣️ Our session on crypto-assets has now finished. Thank you to all of our witnesses for their evidence today. 

📺 Catch up on the session at any time here 👇
https://t.co/bggMDIfArV
👀 Watch what Rebecca Driver from @FSConsumerPanel told us the #crypto world should learn from the collapse of @FTX_official #FTX 👇 https://t.co/qsy97QgtiT

🗣️ Our second panel on crypto-assets has now started. We’re hearing from Sarah Pritchard, Exec Director for Markets and Matthew Long, Director of Payments and Digital Assets @TheFCA.

📺 Watch the session live here 👇
https://t.co/bggMDIfArV

🗣️ Our session on crypto-assets has now started. First up we’re hearing from @josephmdurso (Investigations Writer @TheAthleticFC), and Natasha de Terán & Rebecca Driver (Members @FSConsumerPanel).

📺 Watch the session live here 👇
https://t.co/bggMDIfArV

RT @CommonsTreasury: 📣 On Wednesday we’re holding a session on the crypto-asset industry.

🗣️ We'll hear from two panels: first from consum…

📈 Scrutinising the @bankofengland on inflation
💷 Quizzing the Chancellor @hmtreasury on his Autumn Statement
🔎 Looking in detail at proposed changes to financial services regulations

👀 Watch what new Chair @hbaldwin has been up to in her first month, and what's to come 👇 https://t.co/YhDFRZuKFt

Witnesses:

Panel 1 (2.15pm)
@josephmdurso (Investigations Writer @TheAthleticFC), and Natasha de Terán & Rebecca Driver (Members @FSConsumerPanel)

Panel 2 (approx. 3.15pm)
Sarah Pritchard, Exec Director for Markets and Matthew Long, Director of Payments & Digital Assets @TheFCA

📣 On Wednesday we’re holding a session on the crypto-asset industry.

🗣️ We'll hear from two panels: first from consumer voices on risks & opportunities presented by crypto, and then from @TheFCA on how crypto should be regulated.

📺 Watch from 2.15pm 👇https://t.co/bggMDHXZ3l https://t.co/0YSYs6KlAY

urls.title: Treasury Committee Chair requests urgent answers on current HMRC outage - Committees - UK Parliament
urls.description: The Chair of the Treasury Committee has today asked for urgent answers on the current HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) customer service outage.

data.text:
🖋️ Chair @hbaldwin has today written to @HMRCgovuk to request urgent answers on the current HMRC customer service outage. 

🔎 Learn more and read the letter in full here 👇
https://t.co/rbank41TQ8

🔎 The new Chair of the Treasury Committee, @hbaldwin, has had a busy first month scrutinising the work of @hmtreasury, the @bankofengland, @HMRCgovuk and many more.

🗣️ Watch what the Chair has to say about the role of the Committee and what's to come 👇 https://t.co/6RYKWtqf8c

Angel…

https://t.co/pPkBUzJP9P

urls.title: Treasury Committee publishes correspondence on proposed regulatory ‘call in’ power - Committees - UK Parliament
urls.description: The Treasury Committee today publishes correspondence confirming the Government will not proceed with the proposed ‘call-in’ power in the Financial Services and Markets Bill.

data.text:
📩 The Government has confirmed it won't proceed with a proposed regulatory ‘call-in’ power, which would have enabled the Treasury to make, amend or revoke regulators’ rules.

We've taken a large volume of evidence on the proposal recently - read more 👇

https://t.co/LuUOiwMLLY
👀 Watch @angelaeagle ask Chancellor @Jeremy_Hunt @hmtreasury why he reduced the bank corporation tax surcharge in the #AutumnStatement 👇 https://t.co/jocHhoOHGx

🗣️ Following its correspondence with @ThePSR, the Sub-Committee will hold a session on PSR CP22/4 and authorised push payment fraud on Tuesday 13 December. 

We’ll hear from the Chief Execs of @ThePSR, @financialombuds & @WeArePayUK.

🔜 We'll share a live broadcast link soon. https://t.co/TJFsOsx7RW

urls.title: Treasury Sub-Committee to investigate proposals for mandatory scam reimbursement - Committees - UK Parliament
urls.description: The Treasury Sub-Committee on Financial Services Regulations today publishes correspondence on new proposals for banks to be required to reimburse scam victims.

data.text:

urls.title: Committee questions Chancellor, OBR and experts on Autumn Statement - Committees - UK Parliament
urls.description: The Treasury Committee scrutinises the Chancellor of the Exchequer’s Autumn Statement across three sessions next week.

data.text:

📊 Economists on Monday 21 November

📈 @OBR_UK on Tuesday 22 November

urls.title: Committee Corridor • A podcast on Anchor
urls.description: Welcome to Committee Corridor, the podcast that brings together Members of Parliament from the different select committees in the House of Commons to interview experts and discuss the most pressing political, social and economic matters facing the UK today. Join Darren Jones MP, Chair of the Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy Committee, and his fellow colleagues from across the political spectrum to gain a deeper insight into the issues that the cross-party select committees are considering and how they’re working to make a difference in Westminster.

urls.title: Committee Corridor: coping with rising energy bills
urls.description: The Committee Corridor podcast has released its second episode of series two, focussing on rising energy bills and the cost of living crisis.

urls.title: Government confirms regulatory ‘call in’ power amendment to be delayed - Committees - UK Parliament
urls.description: The Treasury Committee today criticises the Government’s “sub-optimal” approach to the scrutiny of major changes to financial regulation. Treasury Committee

data.text:
🖋️ Yesterday, Economic Secretary to @hmtreasury @griffitha told us that the Govt no longer plans to table its “public interest intervention power” amendment to the Financial Services & Markets Bill at Committee stage

urls.title: MPs question Bank of England financial stability chief following September mini-budget - Committees - UK Parliament
urls.description: The Treasury Committee are likely to explore the methodology of the Bank’s £65 billion facility to purchase UK government bonds in response to stresses in bond markets and pension funds exposed to liability-driven investments (LDI). Potential topics include the effectiveness of the Bank’s intervention, the role of the Treasury and its ministers in supporting financial stability in recent times, and how the Bank’s intervention will be unwound.

data.text:
📣 On Wednesday, we're questioning Sir Jon Cunliffe, Deputy Governor for Financial Stability @bankofengland, on the impact of @hmtreasury's #minibudget2022

🗣️ After, we'll be scrutinising the appointment of David Roberts as Chair of Court @bankofengland

https://t.co/6zpB1CvsXE

👀 Watch Professor Jagjit Chadha, Director of @NIESRorg, describe 'guerrilla tactics' against independent economic institutions leading to higher interest rates and budget deficits 👇 https://t.co/Si7Otp4S29

🗣️ Our session on the September 2022 Fiscal Event with @resfoundation, @NIESRorg, @instituteforgov, @TheIFS and @DeutscheBank has now finished. Thank you to our witnesses for their evidence today.

📺 Catch up on the session at any time 👇
https://t.co/QYUOuIJ5Rt

#minibudget2022
👀 Watch Sanjay Raja, Chief UK Economist @DeutscheBank, explain how UK-specific factors, on top of global trends, have led to recent UK market dysfunction 👇 https://t.co/N9WlVHHArw

tweets.text:
🗣️ Following its correspondence with @ThePSR, the Sub-Committee will hold a session on PSR CP22/4 and authorised push payment fraud on Tuesday 13 December. 

We’ll hear from the Chief Execs of @ThePSR, @financialombuds & @WeArePayUK.

🔜 We'll share a live broadcast link soon. https://t.co/TJFsOsx7RW

urls.title: Treasury Committee Chair requests urgent answers on current HMRC outage - Committees - UK Parliament
urls.description: The Chair of the Treasury Committee has today asked for urgent answers on the current HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) customer service outage.

tweets.text:
🖋️ Chair @hbaldwin has today written to @HMRCgovuk to request urgent answers on the current HMRC customer service outage. 

🔎 Learn more and read the letter in full here 👇
https://t.co/rbank41TQ8

🗣️ Our second panel on crypto-assets has now started. We’re hearing from Sarah Pritchard, Exec Director for Markets and Matthew Long, Director of Payments and Digital Assets @TheFCA.

📺 Watch the session live here 👇
https://t.co/bggMDIfArV

🗣️ Our session on crypto-assets has now started. First up we’re hearing from @josephmdurso (Investigations Writer @TheAthleticFC), and Natasha de Terán & Rebecca Driver (Members @FSConsumerPanel).

📺 Watch the session live here 👇
https://t.co/bggMDIfArV

Witnesses:

Panel 1 (2.15pm)
@josephmdurso (Investigations Writer @TheAthleticFC), and Natasha de Terán & Rebecca Driver (Members @FSConsumerPanel)

Panel 2 (approx. 3.15pm)
Sarah Pritchard, Exec Director for Markets and Matthew Long, Director of Payments & Digital Assets @TheFCA

📣 On Wednesday we’re holding a session on the crypto-asset industry.

🗣️ We'll hear from two panels: first from consumer voices on risks & opportunities presented by crypto, and then from @TheFCA on how crypto should be regulated.

📺 Watch from 2.15pm 👇https://t.co/bggMDHXZ3l https://t.co/0YSYs6KlAY

🗣️ Our session with the senior leadership of @HMRCgovuk has now started. 

📺 Watch the session live here 👇
https://t.co/qhfIntafX1

📣 On Wednesday we’re scrutinising the work of @HMRCgovuk. We’ll hear from:

Jim Harra, First Permanent Secretary
Angela MacDonald, Second Permanent Secretary
Jonathan Athow, DG for Customer Strategy & Tax Design

📺 Watch the session live from 2.15pm 👇 
https://t.co/qhfIntafX1 https://t.co/nkzGi8cC1F

urls.title: Treasury Sub-Committee to investigate proposals for mandatory scam reimbursement - Committees - UK Parliament
urls.description: The Treasury Sub-Committee on Financial Services Regulations today publishes correspondence on new proposals for banks to be required to reimburse scam victims.

tweets.text:
🔎 Our Sub-Committee on Financial Services Regulations recently considered a number of proposed changes put forward by UK regulators.

🖋️ Today we’ve published correspondence with @TheFCA, @ThePSR & the PRA @bankofengland on some of those proposals 👇

https://t.co/v6gJz0DAC3

🗣️ Our session with Chancellor @Jeremy_Hunt @hmtreasury on the #AutumnStatement has now started. 

📺 Watch the session live here 👇
https://t.co/pAC7XjTzvK

urls.title: Treasury Committee
urls.description: Treasury Committee questions the Chancellor on the Autumn Statement

tweets.text:
💷 Today we’re holding our third session on the #AutumnStatement. 

🗣️ We’ll be hearing from Chancellor of the Exchequer @Jeremy_Hunt @hmtreasury. Watch live from 3pm:

📺 On Parliament TV 👇
https://t.co/pAC7XjTzvK

📺 Watch the session live here 👇
https://t.co/91EA5Gj06M

🗣️ We’ll hear from Richard Hughes (Chair) and Budget Responsibility Committee members Andy King and Professor David Miles.

📺 Watch live from 2.15pm 👇
https://t.co/91EA5GjxWk https://t.co/KlgiFe6GQj

urls.title: Committee questions Chancellor, OBR and experts on Autumn Statement - Committees - UK Parliament
urls.description: The Treasury Committee scrutinises the Chancellor of the Exchequer’s Autumn Statement across three sessions next week.

tweets.text:
🗣️ Next week, we’ll be scrutinising the Chancellor’s #AutumnStatement in three sessions:

📊 Economists on Monday 21 November

📈 @OBR_UK on Tuesday 22 November

💷 Chancellor @Jeremy_Hunt @hmtreasury on Wednesday 23 November

Read more here 👇
https://t.co/A79IwUVgpv https://t.co/v2pHCqiGNO

🗣️ Our session with economists on the #AutumnStatement has now started. 

📺 Watch the session live here 👇
https://t.co/CoqYhAFh4L

Dr Linda Yueh @UniofOxford
Mike Brewer @resfoundation
Samuel Tombs @PantheonMacro
Carl Emmerson @TheIFS 

📺 Watch the session live from 3.15pm 👇
https://t.co/CoqYhAFOUj https://t.co/lA0PQCYtej

https://t.co/WAyNQxNIpc https://t.co/dPxMQupX3S

🗳️ Chair election 🗳️

The Deputy Speaker has announced that @hbaldwin has been elected as Chair of the Treasury Committee. https://t.co/rk8Vn3X88s

🗣️ Our session with the senior leadership of @TheFCA has now started.

📺 Watch the session live here 👇
https://t.co/6Ig6bXndPI

We’ll be hearing from Nikhil Rathi (Chief Executive) and Richard Lloyd OBE (Interim Chair). 

📺 Watch the session live from 3.15pm 👇
https://t.co/6Ig6bXmG0a https://t.co/kgUexuzPYX

urls.title: MPs question Bank of England financial stability chief following September mini-budget - Committees - UK Parliament
urls.description: The Treasury Committee are likely to explore the methodology of the Bank’s £65 billion facility to purchase UK government bonds in response to stresses in bond markets and pension funds exposed to liability-driven investments (LDI). Potential topics include the effectiveness of the Bank’s intervention, the role of the Treasury and its ministers in supporting financial stability in recent times, and how the Bank’s intervention will be unwound.

tweets.text:
📣 On Wednesday, we're questioning Sir Jon Cunliffe, Deputy Governor for Financial Stability @bankofengland, on the impact of @hmtreasury's #minibudget2022

🗣️ After, we'll be scrutinising the appointment of David Roberts as Chair of Court @bankofengland

https://t.co/6zpB1CvsXE

🖋️ Chair @MelJStride has written to Sir John Cunliffe, Deputy Governor for Financial Stability @bankofengland, to ask questions about the Bank's further interventions in the gilt market 👇 https://t.co/q1lHRsIe86

🗣️ Our session on the September 2022 Fiscal Event with @resfoundation, @NIESRorg, @instituteforgov, @TheIFS and @DeutscheBank has now started.

📺 Watch the session live here 👇
https://t.co/QYUOuIJ5Rt
